field.description:
Enter the port you would like varnish to listen on. Defaults to 80.

Before listening on port 80, you must check 'Disable webConfigurator redirect rule' in system advanced options.
Enter the Ip address and port for managment interface. HINT 127.0.0.1:81
Enter advanced startup options to include in rc.d file
Select which storage type you would like to use.
Enter the size of the varnish cache in megabytes. HINT: 1024 == 1 Gigabyte
Enter the minimum number of varnish worker threads.
Enter the maximum number of varnish worker threads.
Enter the timeout time for the worker threads.
Select how varnish will balance clients when using client Load Balance method.

Never Don't cache anything with JSESSION,PHPSESSID set.
Per User This causes a lookup for a given object to include the Cookie.

Note: no-cache no-store private header directives are respected by default.

cache images, css and javascript files (.css .js .txt .gif .jpg .jpeg .bmp .png .ico .img .tga and .wmf .mp3 .ogg)
Always Cache all static content. When cookies are present, varnish will unset it from object before caching.
Never Do not cache static content.
When possible Cache only static content and per user objects when session cache is set to it.
Ignore compression for images files and unknow compression algorithm
Ignore request different form GET HEAD PUT POST TRACE OPTIONS DELETE
Select how to forward clients real IP.
How many time varnish will keep cached objects. HINT 60s, 30m, 1h
How many times restart loop until Error messages.
How many time varnish will send cached objects from a down backend to client. HINT 60s, 30m, 1h
Paste your custom html error page code here.
